flow.descriptionCdata:
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.00e94966-2510-4058-a755-f800045447e9.description=
Adds flow variables into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyNames - the names of the flow variables to use
myValues - the values to assign the flow variables
delimiter - a delimiter separating values and keys.

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.01e2e247-dc19-41ad-bd86-501a88589fdc.prompt=TrustAllRoots\: 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.09b838ba-ac20-4f7e-a23d-c353591732fa.description=
Goes through a set of URLs starting from a URL (or list of URLs) provided as input. The flow visits the web pages in the  input. If allowed ( is greater than zero), it also visits in a recursive manner the URLs that are referred (in hyperlinks) by the previously visited pages. The process repeats up to a certain level of recursion specified in the  input. This prevents the flow from crawling endlessly. The flow will only test a URL once. The tested URLs are classified by the flow as 'good', 'slow' or 'bad', and passed in the corresponding results.

Inputs\:
    baseURL - The list containing the URLs to test, separated by semicolons.
    recurse - Specifies whether the crawler recurs. If set to 'Yes', it recurs to a depth specified by the  input. If set to 'No', the crawler does not recur, regardless of the  input value.
Valid values\: Yes, No
Default value\: No
    recursionDepth - The depth to which the crawler continues to test linked pages.
Value format\: integer numbers greater than or equal to zero    
Default value\: no recursion limit - this means that the crawler can to recur endlessly if the  input is 'Yes'.
    timeout - Specifies how many milliseconds is a page given to respond before being considered slow.
Default value\: 0 - this means that there is no response timeout and a page is considered "good" if it responds successfully.
    allowedDomains - The list containing the domains to browse, separated by semicolons. Does not need to include 's domain.
    username - The user name used for authentication to the URLs.
    password - The password to use for basic authentication to the URLs.
    proxy - The proxy server used to access the web site.
    proxyPort - The proxy server port.
    proxyUsername - The proxy server user name.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the  input value.
    followRedirects - Specifies whether the 'Get' command automatically follows redirects. If you specify a non-Boolean value, the default value is used.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    trustAllRoots - Specifies whether to enable weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted certification authority issued it.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    trustKeystore - The location of the TrustStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS server authentication is used.
Example\: %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts
    trustPassword - The password associated with the TrustStore file.
    characterSet - The character encoding to be used for the HTTP 'Get' request and response.
Default value\: UTF-8
    keystore - The location of the KeyStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS client authentication is used.
Example\: %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts
    keystorePassword - The password associated with the KeyStore file.
    authType - The type of authentication used by this operation when trying to execute the request on the target server. 
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
    useCookies - Specifies whether to enable cookie tracking or not. Cookies are stored between consecutive calls. If you specify a non-Boolean value, the default value is used.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: true 
    userAgent - The value to use if the 'USER_AGENT' HTTP header has to be overwritten.
    kerberosConfFile - The  path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty, the  (Key Distribution Center) and  get their values from the full domain name obtained from the web server URL.
    headerNamesList - The list containing the header names to use for the request.
Example\: Accept,Content-Type
    headerValuesList - The list containing the header values to use for the request. 
Example\: text/plain,application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    queryNamesList - The list containing the names of the query parameters to use for the request. 
Example\: parameterName1,parameterName2 
    queryValuesList - The list containing the values of the query parameters to use for the request. 
Example\: parameterValue1,parameterValue2
    delimiter - The delimiter used to separates list elements.
Default value\: ','

Results\:
    goodURLs - This is the primary output. The list containing the URLs that were tested successfully and before the timeout expired.
    toTest - The list containing the tested URLs.
    badURLs - The list containing the URLs that did not respond, or responded with an HTTP error.
    errorMessage - An informational message that can help determine the cause of error, if an error occurred.
    slowURLs - The list containing the URLs that took longer than  milliseconds to respond. This result is empty if the  is '0'.

Responses\:
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
1. If you need to specify query parameters when making the request, use the  and  inputs. The operation also accepts including query parameters in the URL. For example, http\://hostname\:80/page.asp?parameterName1\=parameterValue1¶meterName2\=parameterValue2. If you specify the same query parameter both through the  and the  inputs, the used value is the one from the , not the one included in the .
2. Apache Tomcat is currently the only supported application server when using form-based authentication.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.0d3b4776-4935-467a-a9c4-5b0abcc5597b.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.1ac6138a-cadc-4eea-989a-69a1837ec5fd.prompt=AllowedDomains\: 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.1c1617e1-0e7d-4e99-b008-513efc7a5365.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.1f1ec6c4-e789-4c45-8374-d8232c5920fe.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.2365b208-5eb6-4cce-9557-722dfca23b68.description=
Iterates through a list of values. Modifying the value of the list and delimiter inputs during iteration is not generally supported.

Inputs\:
list - The list to iterate through.
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list.

Returns\:
The current element of the list, if the response is has more

Responses\:
has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned.
has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list.
failure - failed to process the list.

Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously.

WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.2c4d77df-36f0-4a53-b23e-462936dfe2c9.description=
Subtracts two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The difference of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.2d44c711-57bb-491f-b0c9-9cd33c52afdd.prompt=Proxy Port\: 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.3381e3a3-7996-40f1-8f95-964b622c3f59.prompt=URL\: 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.3ac9d121-cf56-415f-9806-0b68326aea5e.description=

13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.4351bc77-1520-41e1-8437-413ecc3f580a.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.4e8cc51f-18c5-4c1e-8f65-d22dbd541629.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.5225ca89-1eab-4d15-908a-f36f1c3fb6de.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.55bf3c9b-fe0c-4e60-8aa9-3c74823014a0.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.5d2e0f22-5376-4ca1-b8b8-d09f21ffd1f2.description=
Compares two strings lexigraphically.

Inputs\:
String1 - The first string.
String2 - The string to compare string 1 to.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true' then the compare is not case sensitive.

responses\:
before - If string 1 is alphabetically before string 2.
after - If string 1 is alphabetically after string 2.
same - If string 1 is alphabetically equal to string 2.
failure - If Something goes wrong.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.617cf2fc-e523-4882-bdc6-8f82dc674e16.prompt=Username\: 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.676eeddb-7720-42cd-bd79-4414a9bef9e4.description=
Checks to see if a list contains every element in another list.

Inputs\:
sublist -The contained list.
container - The containing list.
delimiter - A delimiter separating elements in the two lists.
ignoreCase - If set to 'True' then the compare is not case sensitive. Default is True

Responses\:
true - sublist is contained in container.
false - sublist is not contained in container.

Results\:
Result - All items contained in the sublist that are not in the container.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.6aa3cdfd-0f69-4b3a-a4d6-dc64b52e68b7.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.6d7a9a7a-73a7-49cd-84a6-c6510f77695b.prompt=Proxy Username\: 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.77bfbda1-0ed4-4d17-b79f-ece249bb2e98.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.78cdc59a-9f38-4da4-92aa-2bb31d0fdc96.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.864ce188-5666-4862-8634-c73a54b36910.description=
Retrieves a URL, measuring the amount of time needed for the retrieval.

Inputs\:
    timeout - Specifies how many milliseconds are considered an acceptable retrieval time. If this input's value is '0', all retrieval times are acceptable.
    url - The URL for which to measure the get time.
    username - The user name used for basic authentication to the URL.
    password - The password to use for basic authentication to the URL.
    authType - The type of authentication used by this operation when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
    kerberosConfFile - The  path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty, the  (Key Distribution Center) and  get their values from the full domain name obtained from the web server URL.
    useCookies - Specifies whether to enable cookie tracking or not. Cookies are stored between consecutive calls. If you specify a non-Boolean value, the default value is used.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: true
    followRedirects - Specifies whether the 'Get' command automatically follows redirects. If you specify a non-Boolean value, the default value is used.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    proxy - The proxy server used to access the web site.
    proxyPort - The proxy server port.
    proxyUsername - The proxy server user name.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the  input value.
    encodeURL - Specifies whether to encode the URL. If you specify a non-Boolean value, the default value is used.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    userAgent - The value to use if the 'USER_AGENT' HTTP header has to be overwritten.
    characterSet - The character encoding to be used for the HTTP 'Get' request and response.
Default value\: UTF-8
    trustAllRoots - Specifies whether to enable weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted certification authority issued it.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    keystore - The location of the KeyStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS client authentication is used.
Example\: %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts
    keystorePassword - The password associated with the KeyStore file.
    trustKeystore - The location of the TrustStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS server authentication is used.
Example\: %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts
    trustPassword - The password associated with the TrustStore file.
    localeLang - The locale language for the date and time string.
Examples\: en, ja
    localeCountry - The locale country for the date and time string. If  is not specified, this input is ingored.
Examples\: US, JP
    headerNamesList - The list containing the header names to use for the request.
Example\: Accept,Content-Type
    headerValuesList - The list containing the header values to use for the request. Example\: text/plain,application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    queryNamesList - The list containing the names of the query parameters to use for the request.
Example\: parameterName1,parameterName2 
    queryValuesList - The list containing the values of the query parameters to use for the request. Example\: parameterValue1,parameterValue2
    delimiter - The delimiter used to separates list elements.
Default value\: ','

Results\:
    FailureMessage - This is the primary output. The final error message returned to the user.
    urls - The list containing the links from the given URL, separated by semicolons.

Responses\:
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    diagnosed - The web page was retrieved, but it took more than  milliseconds.

Notes\:
1. You can use KeyTool to import a SSL certificate in a KeyStore. For example, to import a certificate in the Java cacerts KeyStore, run\: keytool -import -file c\:/../.cer -alias  -keystore %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts -keystorepass changeit. If the KeyStore does not exist, the command tries to create a new one containing only your certificate.
2. You can use KeyTool to create a certificate chain through the following command\: 
   keytool -genkey -dname "cn\=Mark Jones, ou\=JavaSoft, o\=Sun, c\=US" 
      -alias business -keypass kpi135 -keystore C\:\working\mykeystore 
      -storepass ab987c -validity 180
This creates a certificate chain in a new KeyStore containing only one certificate. It is useful in SSL client authentication because the KeyManager ignores any certificates not included in a certificate chain.
3. If the value assigned to the  input is 'false' and  is empty, the operation tries to use the default trust store, using the password "changeit". 
4. If you need to specify the request header fields, use the  and  inputs. The operation also accepts hidden inputs whose names begin with "header_", but this deprecated. You can add multiple headers.  For example, add an input name called "header_Content-Type" with a 'text/html' value and/or an input name called "header_Content-Length" with a '348' value.  The operation strips off the "header_" prefix from the input name and then creates the "Content-Type" and/or "Content-Length" header with the value you specified. If you specify the same header through both the  and the "header_" hidden inputs, the used value is the one from the  list, and not from the hidden input.
5. If you need to specify query parameters when making the request, use the  and  inputs. The operation also accepts including query parameters in the URL. For example, http\://hostname\:80/page.asp?parameterName1\=parameterValue1¶meterName2\=parameterValue2. If you specify the same query parameter both through the  and the  inputs, the used value is the one from the , not the one included in the .
6. Apache Tomcat is currently the only supported application server when using form-based authentication.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.86c9d545-791b-4220-a813-753bf3d9c6b0.description=

The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.

ignoreCase - If set to 'true' then the compare is not case sensitive.

responses\:
before - If string 1 is alphabetically before string 2.
after - If string 1 is alphabetically after string 2.
same - If string 1 is alphabetically equal to string 2.
failure - If Something goes wrong.

13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.c4318ab0-5196-47d8-a3df-33e43f6d692b.prompt=Should url-testing be recursive 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.c9c3d6c0-b904-4a32-b7c1-1a1ca76af917.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.ccb9dc69-7a67-4cbd-995e-5b9bbb11975e.prompt=Proxy Password\: 13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.d0f3b401-03c1-4853-b52c-85d144a4ca2b.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.description=
Goes through a set of URLs starting from a URL (or list of URLs) provided as input. The flow visits the web pages in the  input. If allowed ( is greater than zero), it also visits in a recursive manner the URLs that are referred (in hyperlinks) by the previously visited pages. The process repeats up to a certain level of recursion specified in the  input. This prevents the flow from crawling endlessly. The flow will only test a URL once. The tested URLs are classified by the flow as 'good', 'slow' or 'bad', and passed in the corresponding results.

Inputs\:
    baseURL - The list containing the URLs to test, separated by semicolons.
    recurse - Specifies whether the crawler recurs. If set to 'Yes', it recurs to a depth specified by the  input. If set to 'No', the crawler does not recur, regardless of the  input value.
Valid values\: Yes, No
Default value\: No
    recursionDepth - The depth to which the crawler continues to test linked pages.
Value format\: integer numbers greater than or equal to zero    
Default value\: no recursion limit - this means that the crawler can to recur endlessly if the  input is 'Yes'.
    timeout - Specifies how many milliseconds is a page given to respond before being considered slow.
Default value\: 0 - this means that there is no response timeout and a page is considered "good" if it responds successfully.
    allowedDomains - The list containing the domains to browse, separated by semicolons. Does not need to include 's domain.
    username - The user name used for authentication to the URLs.
    password - The password to use for basic authentication to the URLs.
    proxy - The proxy server used to access the web site.
    proxyPort - The proxy server port.
    proxyUsername - The proxy server user name.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the  input value.
    followRedirects - Specifies whether the 'Get' command automatically follows redirects. If you specify a non-Boolean value, the default value is used.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    trustAllRoots - Specifies whether to enable weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted certification authority issued it.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: true
    trustKeystore - The location of the TrustStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS server authentication is used.The default value will be provided if trustAllRoots is false.
Default\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
    trustPassword - The password associated with the TrustStore file. If trustAllRoots is false and trustKeystore is empty, trustPassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    characterSet - The character encoding to be used for the HTTP 'Get' request and response.
Default value\: UTF-8
    keystore - The location of the KeyStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS client authentication is used. The default value will be provided if trustAllRoots is false.
Default\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
    keystorePassword - The password associated with the KeyStore file. If trustAllRoots is false and keystore is empty, keystorePassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    authType - The type of authentication used by this operation when trying to execute the request on the target server. 
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
    useCookies - Specifies whether to enable cookie tracking or not. Cookies are stored between consecutive calls. If you specify a non-Boolean value, the default value is used.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: true 
    userAgent - The value to use if the 'USER_AGENT' HTTP header has to be overwritten.
    kerberosConfFile - The  path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty, the  (Key Distribution Center) and  get their values from the full domain name obtained from the web server URL.
    headerNamesList - The list containing the header names to use for the request.
Example\: Accept,Content-Type
    headerValuesList - The list containing the header values to use for the request. 
Example\: text/plain,application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    queryNamesList - The list containing the names of the query parameters to use for the request. 
Example\: parameterName1,parameterName2 
    queryValuesList - The list containing the values of the query parameters to use for the request. 
Example\: parameterValue1,parameterValue2
    delimiter - The delimiter used to separates list elements.
Default value\: ','

Results\:
    goodURLs - This is the primary output. The list containing the URLs that were tested successfully and before the timeout expired.
    toTest - The list containing the tested URLs.
    badURLs - The list containing the URLs that did not respond, or responded with an HTTP error.
    errorMessage - An informational message that can help determine the cause of error, if an error occurred.
    slowURLs - The list containing the URLs that took longer than  milliseconds to respond. This result is empty if the  is '0'.

Responses\:
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
1. If you need to specify query parameters when making the request, use the  and  inputs. The operation also accepts including query parameters in the URL. For example, http\://hostname\:80/page.asp?parameterName1\=parameterValue1¶meterName2\=parameterValue2. If you specify the same query parameter both through the  and the  inputs, the used value is the one from the , not the one included in the .
2. Apache Tomcat is currently the only supported application server when using form-based authentication.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.e01c995e-6bea-4c19-bc66-dd03f5f5200d.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);

Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.f6200912-4261-4918-97c1-18152ceb7ab6.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.faf3607c-ee7d-42d0-bb01-464fbf17d2df.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:

Scriptlet Example\:

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {

}

13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.fc623c52-3c97-4998-add2-41145085b45a.description=
Checks to see whether a String matches a specific rule.
If the  input value is 'RegEx' , the  input value needs to be a regular expression like \: '^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$'. The  input is the actual String to check if it matches the  expression.

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
    toMatch - The String to check if it matches another string.
    matchTo - The String to match against. 
    ignoreCase - A Boolean value specifying  whether to ignore case during matching.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. Returns "Matches" if the String matched. Otherwise, returns  "Does not Match."

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully. The String matched.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. The most likely reason is that the String did not match.
13a8121d-ed37-4449-88f1-252d90fcff55.ffef1adc-0030-4bfe-a6fc-080aff3c7ef0.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
